pullRequest.body:
Removes the condition of `coeff_one_pow` that the constant coefficient must be 1.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [7ef52a56b3](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14895/commits/7ef52a56b37a94d21f99de03fe5b472551aa1a30)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic | 987 | 991 | +4 (+0.41%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>7 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.LaurentSeries` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Derivative` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.ZetaValues` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.BernoulliPolynomials` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Order` `Mathlib.NumberTheory.Bernoulli` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Inverse`</details>|1|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.WellKnown` `Mathlib.RingTheory.HahnSeries.PowerSeries` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Trunc` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic`</details>|4|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Can you add back the previous theorem, as a special case of the new result?
Is it really needed, or cannot one just apply this result and go one with rewriting the constantCoeff and using `one_pow`?

> Is it really needed, or cannot one just apply this result and go one with rewriting the constantCoeff and using `one_pow`?

Hmm, you're right, it's not that natural and we can live without it.
Noted and closed, thanks.
I think Antoine was answering my comment, saying there is no need to add the current result back. Your generalization looks totally fine.

You also have a conflict... otherwise LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: rwst can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
That conflict is not really there. I merged master without change, and CI builds Mathlib without problems.

> That conflict is not really there. I merged master without change, and CI builds Mathlib without problems.

Did you pull before merging? It says it is in ` Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Basic.lean `.

> > That conflict is not really there. I merged master without change, and CI builds Mathlib without problems.
> 
> Did you pull before merging? It says it is in `Mathlib/RingTheory/PowerSeries/Basic.lean`.

I have edited it in browser.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10021406777/job/27700031502)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10021406777/job/27700031676)
Are these changes wanted?
These were made by `lake exe shake --fix`.
Meaning that `shake` complains without them?
OK, it builds without that line.
It seems that theorem holds if n = 0 (for ridiculous reasons) : both sides are zero.
Even better then!

```suggestion
/-- First coefficient of the `n`-th power of a power series. -/
lemma coeff_one_pow (n : ‚Ñï) (œÜ : R‚ü¶X‚üß) :
    coeff R 1 (œÜ ^ n) = n * coeff R 1 œÜ * (constantCoeff R œÜ) ^ (n - 1) := by
  rcases n.eq_zero_or_pos with rfl | hn
  ¬∑ simp
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Powerseries): generalize `coeff_one_pow`
